step_original: Common Health Entry Document for Feed and Food of Non-Animal Origin (CHED-D) (as set out in Part 2, Section D of Annex II to Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/1715 (OJ L 261))
step_description: Common Health Entry Document for Feed and Food of Non-Animal Origin (CHED-D)
step_howto_description: The release into free circulation of consignments of rice or products containing, consisting of or produced from rice shall be subject to the presentation of a CHED-D or a CVED-P duly completed by the competent authority once all official controls have been carried out. Exemptions apply to consignments which are destined to a private person for personal consumption and use only.
